subject: Sales
title: Patent Medicine: Sales' Dark Chapter
description: One-minute skill: Patent Medicine: Sales' Dark Chapter.

hook.text: In the 1800s, bottled 'miracle cures' outsold real medicine. Most contained alcohol, opium, or nothing.

buildup.text: Patent medicine peddlers were brilliant marketers: testimonials, dramatic stories, and urgent claims.

discovery.text: They pioneered techniques still used today: emotional appeals, authority figures, and manufactured urgency.

twist.text: The Pure Food and Drug Act of 1906 cracked down on fraud. But the marketing playbook survived intact.

climax.text: Patent medicine reminds us: selling techniques are powerful enough to move harm just as easily as help.

punchline.text: Great marketing sold poison. Ethics matter always.

quiz.question: What ended the patent medicine era?
options: The Pure Food and Drug Act of 1906
